article_title: Report: More sharks, rays threatened with extinction
meta_description: PARIS (AP) — The world's sharks and rays have seen declines in their populations since 2014 and more and more are now threatened with extinction, according to a new red list released Saturday at a global conference aimed at protecting dwindling species.

article_title: Louisiana 1 week after Ida: Widespread power outages persist, death toll mounts
meta_description: Nearly one week on, Louisiana is struggling to recover from Hurricane Ida’s devastating blow.

article_title: Hurricane Larry, Big 12 Conference, breast milk antibodies: 5 Things podcast
meta_description: Plus, vaccinated moms have antibodies in their breast milk and and Friday was a memorable day of upsets at the U.S. Open.

article_title: Abortion rights groups want Biden to use bully pulpit after Texas law
meta_description: President Biden is under pressure to do more to support reproductive rights after the Supreme Court allowed Texas to move forward with its abortion law, the most restrictive in the nation.

article_title: Accused Parkland shooter Nikolas Cruz can't be called an 'animal' or 'thing' at trial, judge warns prosecutors and witnesses
meta_description: The judge ruled Cruz can still be referred to as "school shooter," "murderer," and "killer," according to WPTV.

article_title: Apple walks back plans for new child safety tools after privacy backlash
meta_description: Apple made headlines — and not the good kind — last month when it announced a test of a new tool aimed at combating child exploitation. Critics quickly decried the feature's potential privacy implications, and now Apple is taking a long pit stop before moving forward with its plans.

article_title: GOP Sen. Pat Toomey says that Trump should not be the party's 2024 presidential nominee, slams his 'unacceptable' behavior
meta_description: "I think that the future of our party is to be a party of ideas, and not to be a party about any one individual," Toomey said in a CNBC interview.

article_title: Illinois lawmakers override Pritzker’s ambulance veto, fail to agree on ethics changes
meta_description: Lawmakers went around Gov. J.B. Pritzker to enact a law about paying for ambulance services, delivering the first veto override of the governor’s term.

article_title: What is an NFT? Everything to know about the expensive digital tokens taking over cryptocurrency
meta_description: NFTs are tied to all types of art, but that doesn't mean you own it. We'll explain.

article_title: Jill Biden returns to teaching at college after being only first lady to hold full-time job
meta_description: Biden will commute via motorcade to the Alexandria campus, wearing a mask every Tuesday and Thursday, and will even hold office hours. Secret service agents will be with her.

article_title: Texas judge protects Planned Parenthood from lawsuits filed by anti-abortion group
meta_description: A state judge has granted a temporary restraining order against an anti-abortion group, blocking it from suing abortion providers employed by Planned Parenthood, who are now at risk of facing legal action under a controversial law implemented earlier this week.

article_title: Already vaccinated against Covid-19? Experts say you're protected, even without a booster shot
meta_description: Health experts are reinforcing the point that full vaccination remains highly effective against severe illness and death caused by Covid-19 as federal regulators consider the possibility of authorizing a third dose in the upcoming weeks.

article_title: Florida teachers on edge as mask war, COVID surge mark first weeks of school
meta_description: American Federation of Teachers President Randi Weingarten crouched to sit at a first-graders’ table in a Florida school, chatting with masked 6-year-olds about books and their former kindergarten teacher, Mrs. Smith.

article_title: Three doses of Covid-19 vaccine are likely needed for full protection, Fauci says
meta_description: With the latest Covid-19 surge upending American life yet again, an official rollout of booster doses could begin within weeks, pending FDA authorization. And it's likely that three doses of the vaccine are needed for full protection, Dr. Anthony Fauci said.

article_title: Opinion: This Labor Day, meet America's newest union-in-the-making
meta_description: Reshma Saujani argues that unions have been key to many of the gains for workers we celebrate on Labor Day, and says it's well past time to unionize a movement among the biggest group of unrecognized, unsupported workers in the US: mothers.

article_title: New Orleans is transporting some residents to shelters as hundreds of thousands remain without power after Hurricane Ida
meta_description: As hundreds of thousands of Louisiana residents struggle in sweltering conditions and without power six days after deadly Hurricane Ida struck, some are trying their luck elsewhere.

article_title: Landlord finds 19 tarantulas and python in abandoned Maine apartment
meta_description: In Maine, animal rescuer Drew Desjardins helped save 15 tarantulas and one python out of an abandoned apartment. The animals are illegal in Maine.

article_title: 'Resist': Russian opposition candidates rally media
meta_description: A dozen opposition candidates for Russia's September parliamentary election met scores of journalists in Moscow on Saturday with a message of resistance against the Kremlin's squeezing of independent media.

article_title: Taliban special forces bring abrupt end to women’s protest
meta_description: KABUL, Afghanistan (AP) — Taliban special forces in camouflage fired their weapons into the air Saturday, bringing an abrupt and frightening end to the latest protest march in the capital by Afghan women demanding equal rights from the new rulers.

article_title: Afghanistan could be catalyst for common EU migration policy -commissioner
meta_description: Events in Afghanistan could be a catalyst for the European Union to forge a common migration policy, European Commissioner Margaritis Schinas said in a newspaper interview.

article_title: Germany urges vaccine shots; warns of fall COVID-19 surge
meta_description: BERLIN (AP) — Germany's top health official is urging more citizens to get vaccinated, warning Saturday that if the vaccination numbers don't go up the country's hospitals may get overwhelmed by COVID-19 patients toward the end of the year.

article_title: Bette Midler calls on women to refuse sex to protest Texas abortion law
meta_description: Actress Bette Midler called for women to refuse to have sex to protest Texas’s recently enacted abortion law and suggested that Congress should guarantee abortion rights for women.

article_title: Why can't we mandate anything?
meta_description: Our research shows it's part of a broad global decline in how people see the legitimacy of apolitical, rational state bureaucracies.

meta_description: Ethan Goin, 16, allegedly felt he was being bullied the day he broke into 48-year-old Vergel Guintu’s house and killed him, police said.

meta_description: Federal prosecutors must disclose the "identities of any unnamed co-conspirators" whose names they plan to refer to at trial to Ghislaine Maxwell, a federal judge ruled on Friday.
